conclusion: The task is to predict which container (E or F) the liquid from points A, B, C, and D will flow into after passing through baffles.
The diagram has a black background with colored shapes representing paths for liquid flow. Points A, B, C, and D are at the top, and containers E and F are at the bottom.
Points A, B, C, and D are labeled with different colors: A is green, B is orange, C is light blue, and D is dark blue.
The first image shows liquid dripping from points A, B, C, and D.
In the second image, liquids are flowing downward from points A, B, C, and D, diverging towards the bottom containers.
The green liquid from A seems to be heading towards container E, while the orange liquid from B is flowing towards container F.
The third image shows a more developed flow pattern, with liquids mixing but generally heading towards specific containers.
The green liquid from point A flows downward and slightly to the left, heading towards container E.
The orange liquid from point B flows downward and slightly to the right, heading towards container F.
The light blue liquid from point C flows downward, heading towards container F.
The dark blue liquid from point D flows downward and to the right, heading towards container F.
Both liquids from points C and D seem to be heading towards container F, while liquids from points A and B are heading towards containers E and F respectively.
